arguments.title: WebSocket Implementation for Real-time Notifications
arguments.content:
We have decided to implement real-time notifications using WebSockets instead of traditional polling. This decision was made after evaluating the tradeoffs between the two approaches.

Benefits of WebSockets:
- Real-time communication with low latency
- Reduced server load compared to frequent polling
- Better user experience with instant notifications
- More efficient use of bandwidth

Tradeoffs considered:
- Increased complexity in implementation and debugging
- Need for proper connection management and error handling
- Additional infrastructure requirements for WebSocket servers
- Potential issues with firewalls and proxy servers
- More complex state management on both client and server sides

The polling approach was deemed less suitable due to:
- Higher latency in notification delivery
- Increased server load from frequent requests
- Inefficient use of network resources
- Poor user experience with delayed notifications
